title: Maxre
author: Maxre
content: Hi guys I have joined crypto since a very long time maybe form 2018. At that time I have had no knowledge and I went to join some airdrops but earnings was very low. Here I met many new telegram members and everyone trying to Scam with with me. Mostly of them are from USA, Nigeria and UK. some people use Women voice and they trap new people to join investment scheme and other such things. As telegram is much more secure than any other Social media that's why there are a lot of Scammers than any other platform. And I think that sucks. And these are the people in which new People don't believe in crypto and we have to change it. I have blocked almost 100+ Scammers and there are more people coming and everyone has their own strategy to Scam with us. Is this happened to you or only me.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: No, it's not just you that scammers have attempted to scam. Once you join any new crypto telegram group, both exchange and normal, and drop a message like "Who is the admin here? I have a problem," just wait for a few minutes and see your account flooded with messages, most of which have a custom name and picture similar to the real admin, and they will attempt to offer you a solution, but their main objective is to scam you, penetrate your account, and make away with your funds.  Some of go through almost every telegram group and search for members active ones most especially and send them a DM with investment offer some go as far as sending broker website link, telegram channels which they update with there fake transaction history. Do you know some funny fact of this lies, most of them don't actually know how the Blockchain transaction works, they upload a different transaction ID, different wallet and a different amount which they claim they might have just paid there investors. If you scan the wallet you fine out that some of them have never even received any deposit since the wallet was created, why some are some old transaction of years ago. We can keep on reporting there accounts but that won't stop them, we just have to be smart enough to avoid them and not fall victim of such scam. Quote from: Maxre on March 26, 2023, 02:23:54 PMwe have to change it. How do you plan on changing it?

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Simply because scamming and foolong people is a lot easier through the use of internet; convenience for them in a way that they'd have a higher chance not to be known by their victim and to not be caught by authorities easily. Internet is a product of technological advancements indeed but behind its advantages is also its disadvantages especially for those who are not that knowledgeable with the potential and risks involved. This simply won't stop as long as they have people being victimized by them. Same scheme will be present as long as there are people who keeps on falling for it. What's best is to equip oneself with knowledge in order to be aware of the do's and dont's not only in this industry but to all possible means.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Yeah, it has happened to me. Most times it happens when you go to the official channel of a project or anything that has to do with crypto and then make a complain, you'll see so many of them running to your PM claiming that they are part of the project's team and they can help you solve whatever issues it is that you're struggling with. But in the end all they want is an opportunity for them to request a sensitive information that you won't easily give out. You have to be careful when dealing with strangers online most especially when it has to do with you putting your money into it or you giving out any personal information.

comments.author: S A KHAIR
comments.body: There are bad people and good people everywhere, even in your family, there are bad people and good people. So what do you expect in a virtual world on the internet? It's not too difficult to avoid those scam traps, as long as you don't have greed, don't want to receive free money, and don't want to steal from others, you will never fall into the trap of scammers. Don't just blame the scammers when you've been greedy and self-damaged.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: This is a self-evident conclusion. Why are scammers so popular on the Internet? It is probably not difficult for anyone to guess that people feel impunity from the fact that they assume that they are anonymous. On the Internet, we can introduce ourselves as anyone, from a successful trader to an investor who hit a big jackpot on this or that crypto project.In my country, groups advertising to attract naive people appear daily. Of course, we cannot warn everyone, but we must inform those who are close to us as quickly as possible, as scammers are proactive, each time telling the victims that they have little time and need to make a decision quickly.https://newdaycrypto.com/a-resident-of-novokuznetsk-invested-6-7-million-rubles-in-a-crypto-fraud-project/

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 26, 2023, 02:23:54 PMAs telegram is much more secure than any other Social media that's why there are a lot of Scammers than any other platform. I think you mean the opposite with telegram being the most secure. The security you get on telegram is as much as you give it. It is really loose and serves as a window of opportunity for scammers to refer you off a secured platform where your convo could be monitored and in turn blocked to a more free space like telegram where they could communicate with you without fear of getting bursted by the security team behind the platform.Good enough you've taken steps in blocking accounts you've associated with scam but, that won't keep you away from them just yet. The ease of creating new accounts and channels actually means, your still up for more adds or communicated by these scammers with a new name.Setting your privacy settings would go a long way to limit who adds you to what channel, who sees your contact, views your uploads and more. Meanwhile, you be mindful of how you portray yourself in certain groups.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 26, 2023, 02:23:54 PMAs telegram is much more secure than any other Social media that's why there are a lot of Scammers than any other platform. And I think that sucks. And these are the people in which new People don't believe in crypto and we have to change it. <...>I'm not really sure about this claim. While Telegram does have some features that can enhance security, such as end-to-end encryption for messages and a two-factor authentication option, it's still possible for scammers to operate on the platform and try to deceive users. Therefore, I'm not convinced that Telegram necessarily has more scammers than any other platform solely because of its security features.Scammers can be very convincing and use a variety of tactics to deceive people, including creating fake profiles, offering fake investment opportunities, or impersonating legitimate businesses or individuals. It's possible that scammers target Telegram because of its large user base, but, most likely, Telegram is a breeding ground for scammers because of the many naive and gullible people who fall for scams. However, scams can happen on any platform, and it's up to individual users to be cautious and skeptical of any messages or requests they receive, regardless of the platform they're on.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Only makes sense for the internet and adjacently bitcoin to be the festering ground for these scammers. It's the scammer's dream after all, limited traceability, easy transaction, and more. At this point it's become a rite of passage for some to be hacked before they make it in this industry which I know, shouldn't even happen in the first place. But at the end of the day, if you don't protect yourself from these bad actors, bitcoin or not you will get targeted. So as with all these guys who commented on your post I implore you to restrict people from messaging you at all, the benefits outweigh the risks in this case, and always make sure that you don't belligerently click on anything suspicious, no matter who asks you to click it.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: I feel like your telegram user is on the scamming list, that's why they keep coming to your account. Maybe on this point, you should change your telegram account to a new one, but not sure if that would fix anything.Is easy for the scammers to make list because the groups are public, so, they can join to a casino telegram group or an exchange telegram group, that way they know all the users on that server use cryptos, that is how they get their client list to try to scam. So my recommendation is to not be in groups involved in crypto, is the best way to avoid getting new users trying to scam you every day.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: Telegram was one of the first platforms where I started my crypto journey, and it was like a hub for scammers. I’m pretty sure every group on telegram crypto related or not, there’s always one fake account there trying to sell you on some hyip. At the time I knew anyone who sent me a dm first was most likely a scammer. In the end, I deleted my account because I was tired of seeing dms from strangers and it was counterproductive to my crypto experience. My advice to OP is to limit your activities on telegram, if you have to use the app you should set your privacy to prevent strangers from adding you to groups and channels.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: To steer clear of scams, all you have to do is block them. These scams often lure in newbies with enticing but deceitful offers, which is why even scammers manage to get money from some people. I've received similar messages, but I simply block them as I don't want to waste my time engaging with them. It doesn't matter to me if they're male or female or where they're from. My advice is not to try and get rich quick with crypto, as this may increase your chances of falling victim to scams.
